categories.Very Negative: The text expresses strong negative emotions such as anger, disgust, frustration, sadness, or intense criticism. It may include harsh language, personal attacks, complaints, or expressions of extreme dissatisfaction.
categories.Negative: The text conveys a generally unfavorable sentiment, such as mild disappointment, annoyance, concern, or critique. It may include dissatisfaction but lacks extreme negativity.
categories.Neutral: The text does not express clear positive or negative emotions. It may be factual, objective, or lack any sentiment-driven language.
categories.Positive: The text conveys a favorable sentiment, such as mild appreciation, happiness, excitement, or approval. It may contain praise, encouragement, or expressions of satisfaction but without strong intensity.
categories.Very positive: The text expresses strong positive emotions such as enthusiasm, joy, deep appreciation, or excitement. It may include highly supportive language, strong praise, admiration, or expressions of extreme satisfaction.

examples.item: where are you going  why are you approaching me  can you not  sir can I what  what the fuck  what the fuck
I will stand with you between the heavens and the earth  I will tell you where you are  do you love me I love you
what on earth is going on in the house of Commons
What do you want to be when you grow up
